intro: Spermacoce noronhensis, commonly known as the Brazilian morning glory, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers that bloom in the early morning. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender stems and opposite leaves. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, smooth seeds. Spermacoce noronhensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along stream banks.
